# Equations

This section describes the equations used in the Pacific Herring statistical catch-age model.
Symbols and constants are described in Table \@ref(tab:variables).
These equations will not be included in the final document.

## Steady-state model

For the steady-state conditions represented below, we assume the parameter vector Theta in Eq. 1  is unknown and would be estimated by fitting ISCAM to data. For a given set of growth parameters and maturity-at-age parameters defined by Phi in Eq. 2, growth is assumed to follow von Bertalanffy (Eq. 3), mean weight-at-age is given by the allometric relationship in Eq. 4, and
the age-specific vulnerability is given by an age-based logistic function (Eq. 5). The terms vulnerability and selectivity are used interchangeably throughout this document, although, technically, selectivity refers to the fishing gear, while vulnerability refers to all processes affecting the availability of fish to the fishery. Selectivity parameters can be fixed or estimated.
Survivorship for unfished and fished populations is defined by Eq. 7 and 8, respectively.
It is assumed that all individuals ages A and older (i.e., the plus group) have the same total mortality rate. The incidence functions refer to the life-time or per-recruit quantities such as spawning biomass per recruit (phi_E, Eq. 9) or vulnerable biomass per recruit (phi_B, Eq. 10).
Note that upper and lower case subscripts denote unfished and fished conditions, respectively.
Unfished spawning biomass is given by Eq. 11 and the recruitment compensation ratio (Myers et al., 1999) is given by Eq. 12. The steady-state equilibrium recruitment for a given fishing
mortality rate Fe is given by Eq. 13. Note that we assume that recruitment follows a Beverton-Holt stock recruitment model of the form shown in Eq. 14, where the maximum juvenile survival rate so is given by:

SH_Still updating

Pacific Herring steady-state age-structured model assuming
unequal vulnerability-at-age,
age-specific fecundity, and
Beverton-Holt recruitment.

### Parameters

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df1}
\Theta = (R_o,\,h,\,M)
\end{equation}

where $R_o > 0$, $0.2 \leq h < 1.0$, and $M > 0$.  

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df2}
\Phi = \left(l_{\infty,s},\,\acute{k}_s,\,t_{o,s},\,\acute{a}_s,\,
\acute{b}_s,\,\dot{a}_s,\,\dot{\gamma}_s,\,\hat{a}_k,\,\hat{\gamma}_k\right)
\end{equation}

### Age-schedule information

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df3}
l_{a,s} = l_{}\left(1-e^{\left(-k_s\left(a-t_{o,s}\right)\right)}\right)
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df4}
w_{a,s} = \acute{a}_s(l_{a,s})^{\acute{b}_s}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df5}
v_a = \left(1+e^{\left(\frac{-(\hat{a}-a)}{\hat{\gamma}}\right)}\right)^{-1} 
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df6}
f_{a,s}=w_{a,s}\left(1+e^{\left(\frac{-\left(\dot{a}_s-a_s\right)}
{\dot{\gamma}_s}\right)}\right)^{-1}
\end{equation}

### Survivorship

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df7}
\iota_a =
\begin{cases}
\frac{1}{S}, & a = 1 \\
\iota_{a-1}e^{-M}, & a > 1 \\
\frac{\iota_{a-1}}{(1-e^{-M})}, & a = A \\
\end{cases}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df8}
\iota_a = \begin{cases}
\frac{1}{S}, & a = 1 \\
\hat{\iota}_{a-1,s}e^{-M-F_ev_{a-1,s}}, & a > 1 \\
\frac{\hat{\iota}_{a-1,s}e^{-M-F_ev_{a-1,s}}}{(1-e^{-M-F_e v_{a,s}})}, & a = A \\
\end{cases}
\end{equation}

### Incidence functions

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df9}
\phi_E = \sum_{s=1}^S\sum_{a=1}^\infty \iota_a f_{a,s}, \qquad
\phi_e = \sum_{s=1}^S\sum_{a=1}^\infty \hat{\iota}_{a,s} f_{a,s}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df10}
\phi_B = \sum_{s=1}^S\sum_{a=1}^\infty \iota_a w_{a,s} v_{a,s}, \qquad
\phi_b = \sum_{s=1}^S\sum_{a=1}^\infty \hat{\iota}_{as} w_{a,s} v_{a,s}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df11}
\phi_q = \sum_{s=1}^S\sum_{a=1}^\infty
\frac{\hat{\iota}_{a,s} w_{a,s} v_{a,s}}{M+F_ev_{a,s}}
\left(1-e^{(-M-F_ev_{a,s})}\right)
\end{equation}

### Steady-state conditions

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df12}
B_o = R_o\phi_B
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df13}
\kappa=\frac{4h}{1-h}
\end{equation}

Beverton-Holt recruitment

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df14}
R_e = R_o \frac{\kappa-\frac{\phi_E}{\phi_e}}{\kappa-1}  
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df15}
C_e = F_e R_e \phi_q
\end{equation}

## Catch-age-model

Pacific herring statistical catch-age model using Baranov catch.

### Estimated parameters

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df16}
\Theta = (R_0,\,h,\,M,\,\overline{R},\,\overline{R}_{\mli{init}},\,\vartheta^2,\,\rho,\,
\Gamma_{k,t},\,\{\omega_t\}_{\acute{t}=1-A}^{\acute{t}=T},\,
\{\omega_{\mli{init},t}\}_{t=\acute{t}-A}^{t=\acute{t}-1})
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df17}
\sigma = \sqrt{\rho}\vartheta, \qquad
\tau = \sqrt{\left(1-\rho\right)}\vartheta  
\end{equation}

### Unobserved states

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df18}
N_{t,a,s}, \qquad
SB_t,s, \qquad
Z_{t,a,s}
\end{equation}

### Initial states

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df19}
N_{t,a,s} = \frac{1}{S}\overline{R}_\mli{init}e^{\omega_{\mli{init},t}}e^{-M(a-1)}
\end{equation}

where $(\acute{t}-A) < t < 1$, and $2 \leq a \leq A$.   
 
\begin{equation}\label{eq:df20}
N_{t,a,s} = \frac{1}{S}\bar{R}e^{\omega_{t}}
\end{equation}

where $1 \leq t \leq T$, and $a = 1$.  

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df21}
v_{k,a} = \frac{1}{1+e^{-\frac{\left(a - \hat{a}_k\right)}{\hat{\gamma}_k}}}  
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df22}
F_{k,t} = e^{\Gamma_{k,t}}
\end{equation}

### State dynamics ($t>1$)

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df23}
SB_{t,s} = \sum_a N_{t,a,s}f_{a,s}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df24}
Z_{t,a,s} = M+\sum_k F_{k,t} v_{k,t,a,s}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df25}
\hat{C}_{k,t} = \sum_s \sum_a \frac {N_{{t,a,s}}w_{{a,s}}F_{k,t}
v_{{k,t,a,s}} \left( 1-{e^{-Z_{t,a,s}}} \right) }{Z_{t,a,s}}^{\eta_t}
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df26}
N_{t,a,s} = 
\begin{cases}
\frac{s_oE_{t-1}}{1+\beta E_{t-1}} e^{\left(\omega_t-0.5\tau^2\right)}, & a=1 \\
N_{t-1,a-1,s} e^{\left(-Z_{t-1,a-1,s}\right)}, &a>1 \\
N_{t-1,a,s} e^{\left(-Z_{t-1,a,s}\right)}, & a=A \\
\end{cases}
\end{equation}

### Beverton-Holt recruitment model

\begin{equation}\label{eq:df27}
R_t = \frac{s_oSB_{t-k}}{1+\beta SB_{t-k}}e^{\delta_{t}-0.5\tau^2}
\end{equation}

$R_o$ & & Age-$\acute{a}$ recruits in unfished conditions\\

$\bar{R}_\mli{init}$ & & Average age-$\acute{a}$ recruitment in year $\acute{t}-1$\\
$M_s$ & & Instantaneous natural mortality rate\\
$\hat{a}_k, \hat{\gamma}_k$ & & Selectivity parameters for gear $k$\\
$\Gamma_{k,t}$ & & Logarithm of the instantaneous fishing mortality for gear $k$ in year $t$\\
$\omega_t$ & & Age-$\acute{a}$ deviates from $\bar{R}$ for years $\acute{t}$ to $T$\\
$\omega_{\mli{init},t}$ & & Age-$\acute{a}$ deviates from $\bar{R}_{\mli{init}}$ for year $\acute{t}$\\
$q_s$ & & Catchability parameter for survey $k$\\
$\rho$ & & Fraction of the total variance associated with observation error\\
$\vartheta^2$ & & Total precision (inverse of variance) of the total error\\
\multicolumn{3}{l}{\textbf{Standard deviations}}\\
$\sigma$ & & Standard deviation for observation errors in survey index\\
$\tau$ & & Standard deviation in process errors (recruitment deviations)\\
$\sigma_C$ & & Standard deviation in observed catch by gear\\
\multicolumn{3}{l}{\textbf{Residuals}}\\
$\delta_t$ & & Annual recruitment residual\\
$\eta_t$ & & Residual error in predicted catch\\
\multicolumn{3}{l}{\textbf{Fixed growth and maturity parameters}}\\
$l_{\infty s}$ & & Asymptotic length in millimetres for sex $s$\\
$\acute{k}_s$ & & Brody growth coefficient for sex $s$\\
$t_{o s}$ & & Theoretical age at zero length for sex $s$\\
$\acute{a}_s$ & & Scalar in length-weight allometry for sex $s$\\
$\acute{b}_s$ & & Power parameter in length-weight allometry for sex $s$\\
$\dot{a}_s$ & & Age at 50\% maturity for sex $s$\\
$\dot{\gamma}_s$ & & Standard deviation at 50\% maturity for sex $s$\\
